data.title: Author Patrick Dennis revives Auntie Mame
data.meta_description: In 1956 Edward Everett “Pat” Tanner III, a New York writer working under two pseudonyms, became the first novelist to have three titles on the New York Times bestseller list. Two of those books — The
data.text:
In 1956 Edward Everett “Pat” Tanner III, a New York writer working under two pseudonyms, became the first novelist to have three titles on the New York Times bestseller list. Two of those books — The Loving Couple by Virginia Rowans, and Guestward Ho! credited to Barbara Hooton “as indiscreetly confided to” Patrick Dennis — are long out of print and all but forgotten. The third, however, was Patrick Dennis’s Auntie Mame, which had entered the list a year earlier and remained there for a robust 112 weeks, spawning a play, a film, a Broadway musical, a movie musical and a sturdy American archetype.

More than half a century later you still can invoke the name Mame in the United States and be immediately
